name: Colorado Family Adventure
subtitle: Denver â†’ Boulder â†’ Estes Park â†’ Breckenridge

items.title: Arrive at Denver International Airport
items.detail: Fly into DEN. Pick up rental car â€” you'll want one for the mountain drives ahead.

items.title: Lunch at Union Station
items.detail: Grab lunch at Denver Union Station food hall. Try Mercantile Dining or Pigtrain Coffee.

items.title: Denver Art Museum
items.detail: Explore the Denver Art Museum â€” free for kids under 18. The Western American Art collection is a must.

items.title: Check in â€” Downtown Denver Hotel
items.detail: Check in to hotel near LoDo. Walking distance to restaurants and nightlife.

items.title: Dinner on Larimer Square
items.detail: Dinner at Rioja or Osteria Marco on Larimer Square â€” Denver's best dining block.

items.title: Breakfast at Snooze
items.detail: Pancake flights at Snooze â€” a Denver brunch institution. Get there early to beat the line.

items.title: Red Rocks Amphitheatre
items.detail: Visit Red Rocks Park & Amphitheatre. Walk the Trading Post Trail and run the stadium steps â€” free entry when no concert.

items.title: Drive to Boulder
items.detail: 45-minute drive north on US-36 to Boulder. Stunning views of the Flatirons as you approach.

items.title: Lunch on Pearl Street
items.detail: Explore the Pearl Street Mall â€” try The Kitchen or grab a slice at Basta. Street performers add to the vibe.

items.title: Chautauqua Park & Flatirons
items.detail: Hike the Chautauqua Trail for close-up views of the Flatirons. Easy 1-mile loop or harder Royal Arch trail.

items.title: Drive to Estes Park
items.detail: 1.5-hour drive from Boulder to Estes Park. Make sure you have your timed entry reservation for RMNP.

items.title: Bear Lake Trail
items.detail: Start at Bear Lake â€” easy 0.8-mile loop with stunning mountain reflections. Get there early for parking.

items.title: Trail Ridge Road
items.detail: Drive Trail Ridge Road â€” the highest continuous paved road in the US (12,183 ft). Watch for elk and marmots.

items.title: Picnic at Alpine Visitor Center
items.detail: Pack a picnic lunch and enjoy it at the Alpine Visitor Center â€” highest visitor center in the national park system.

items.title: Check in â€” Estes Park Lodge
items.detail: Settle in at a lodge in Estes Park. Walk the riverwalk and browse the shops before dinner.

items.title: Dinner with Elk Views
items.detail: Dinner at Smokin' Dave's BBQ or The Dunraven Inn. Keep an eye out â€” elk wander through town at dusk.

items.title: Drive to Breckenridge via I-70
items.detail: 3-hour drive from Estes Park to Breckenridge through the mountains. Stop at the Eisenhower Tunnel overlook.

items.title: Lunch on Main Street
items.detail: Explore Breckenridge's colorful Victorian Main Street. Try Downstairs at Eric's for pizza or The Canteen for tacos.

items.title: Free Gondola Ride to Peak 8
items.detail: Take the free BreckConnect Gondola up to Peak 8. Summer alpine slide and activities at the Fun Park ($35/person).

items.title: Sapphire Point Overlook
items.detail: Short 1-mile hike to Sapphire Point for panoramic views of Lake Dillon and the surrounding peaks. Easy and family-friendly.

items.title: Dinner in Breckenridge
items.detail: Dinner at Hearthstone Restaurant in a historic Victorian home. Reservations recommended in summer.

items.title: Coffee & Breakfast in Breck
items.detail: Grab coffee at Cool River Coffee House before hitting the road back to Denver.

items.title: Drive back to Denver
items.detail: 1.5-hour drive east on I-70. Stop at the Georgetown Loop scenic overlook if time allows.

items.title: RiNo Art District & Brewery
items.detail: Explore Denver's RiNo (River North) Art District â€” street art, galleries, and craft breweries. Try Ratio Beerworks.

items.title: Last-Minute Shopping
items.detail: Pick up Colorado souvenirs â€” local honey, craft beer, or turquoise jewelry from 16th Street Mall.

items.title: Depart from DEN
items.detail: Head to Denver International Airport. Allow 45 minutes for the drive from downtown.

notifications.text: Your 5-day Colorado itinerary is ready! 26 activities across 4 destinations.
